comments.body: you probably need to update the target_column docstring also as it is not used when y is 'DataFrame'.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +69,73 @@  Args:
    x: pandas `DataFrame` object.
    y: pandas `Series` object or `DataFrame`. `None` if absent.
    batch_size: int, size of batches to return.
    num_epochs: int, number of epochs to iterate over data. If not `None`,

comments.body: in order to make this check valid, it is critical to add a precheck above to ensure the target_column passed in must not be a list.

Should it be valid for the `target_column` passed to be a list? I don't think it was valid before so this wouldn't be a behavior change so adding the precheck makes sense. Will do unless there's some compelling reason it should be able to be a list.

Your point is absolutely correct. target_column should not be list before your PR. The precheck is just to ensure we could give user a clear error message and do not surprise users. Thanks for the supporting.
